00024 #include "MSDataAnalyzer.hpp"
00025 #include "util/unit.hpp"
00026 #include <iostream>

00029 using namespace std;
00030 using namespace pwiz::util;
00031 using namespace pwiz::analysis;

00033 
00034 ostream* os_ = 0;
00035 
00036 
00037 struct SimpleAnalyzer : public MSDataAnalyzer
00038 {
00039     size_t index;
00040     bool opened;
00041     int updateCount;
00042     bool closed;
00043 
00044     SimpleAnalyzer(size_t _index) : index(_index), opened(false), updateCount(0), closed(false) {}
00045 
00046     virtual void open(const DataInfo& dataInfo) 
00047     {
00048         // initialize everything, since Analyzers may be reused
00049         opened = false;
00050         updateCount = 0; 
00051         closed=false;
00052 
00053         // do something   
00054         opened = true; 
00055     }
00056 
00057     virtual UpdateRequest updateRequested(const DataInfo& dataInfo, 
00058                                           const SpectrumIdentity& entry) const 
00059     {
00060         // only request this->index
00061         return entry.index == index ? UpdateRequest_NoBinary : UpdateRequest_None;
00062     }
00063 
00064     virtual void update(const DataInfo& dataInfo, 
00065                         const Spectrum& spectrum) 
00066     {
00067         if (os_) *os_ << "[" << index << "]" << " update: " << spectrum.index << endl;
00068         updateCount++;
00069     }
00070 
00071     virtual void close(const DataInfo& dataInfo) {closed = true;}
00072 };
00073 
00074 
00075 struct SimpleProgressCallback : public MSDataAnalyzerDriver::ProgressCallback
00076 {
00077     size_t count;
00078 
00079     SimpleProgressCallback() : count(0) {}
00080 
00081     virtual size_t iterationsPerCallback() const {return 5;}
00082 
00083     virtual MSDataAnalyzerDriver::Status progress(size_t index, size_t size)
00084     {
00085         if (os_) *os_ << "progress: " << index << "/" << size << endl;
00086         count++;
00087         return MSDataAnalyzerDriver::Status_Ok;
00088     }
00089 };
00090 
00091 
00092 struct CancelProgressCallback : public MSDataAnalyzerDriver::ProgressCallback
00093 {
00094     size_t count;
00095 
00096     CancelProgressCallback() : count(0) {}
00097 
00098     virtual size_t iterationsPerCallback() const {return 5;}
00099 
00100     virtual MSDataAnalyzerDriver::Status progress(size_t index, size_t size)
00101     {
00102         if (os_) *os_ << "progress: " << index << "/" << size << endl;
00103         count++;
00104         return index<5 ? MSDataAnalyzerDriver::Status_Ok : MSDataAnalyzerDriver::Status_Cancel;
00105     }
00106 };
00107 
00108 
00109 void test()
00110 {
00111     if (os_) *os_ << "test()\n"; 
00112 
00113     // set up analyzers
00114 
00115     MSDataAnalyzerContainer analyzers;
00116     analyzers.push_back(MSDataAnalyzerPtr(new SimpleAnalyzer(23))); // request index 23
00117     analyzers.push_back(MSDataAnalyzerPtr(new SimpleAnalyzer(17))); // request index 17
00118 
00119     unit_assert(analyzers.size() == 2);
00120     for (MSDataAnalyzerContainer::const_iterator it=analyzers.begin(); it!=analyzers.end(); ++it)
00121     {
00122         const SimpleAnalyzer& anal = dynamic_cast<const SimpleAnalyzer&>(**it);
00123         unit_assert(!anal.opened);
00124         unit_assert(anal.updateCount == 0);
00125         unit_assert(!anal.closed);
00126     }
00127 
00128     // instantiate MSData object
00129 
00130     MSData dummy;
00131     SpectrumListSimplePtr sl(new SpectrumListSimple);
00132     const int spectrumCount = 30;
00133     for (int i=0; i<spectrumCount; i++) 
00134     {
00135         sl->spectra.push_back(SpectrumPtr(new Spectrum));
00136         sl->spectra.back()->index = i;
00137     }
00138     dummy.run.spectrumListPtr = sl; 
00139 
00140     // run driver
00141 
00142     MSDataAnalyzerDriver driver(analyzers);
00143     SimpleProgressCallback callback;
00144     MSDataAnalyzerDriver::Status status = driver.analyze(dummy, &callback);
00145 
00146     unit_assert(status == MSDataAnalyzerDriver::Status_Ok);
00147 
00148     for (MSDataAnalyzerContainer::const_iterator it=analyzers.begin(); it!=analyzers.end(); ++it)
00149     {
00150         const SimpleAnalyzer& anal = dynamic_cast<const SimpleAnalyzer&>(**it);
00151         unit_assert(anal.opened);
00152         unit_assert(anal.updateCount == 1);
00153         unit_assert(anal.closed);
00154     }
00155 
00156     unit_assert(callback.count == spectrumCount/callback.iterationsPerCallback() + 1);
00157 
00158     // run driver again with cancel callback
00159 
00160     if (os_) *os_ << "testing cancel callback:\n";
00161 
00162     CancelProgressCallback cancelCallback;
00163     status = driver.analyze(dummy, &cancelCallback);
00164 
00165     unit_assert(status == MSDataAnalyzerDriver::Status_Cancel);
00166 
00167     if (os_) *os_ << "cancelled!\n";
00168 
00169     for (MSDataAnalyzerContainer::const_iterator it=analyzers.begin(); it!=analyzers.end(); ++it)
00170     {
00171         const SimpleAnalyzer& anal = dynamic_cast<const SimpleAnalyzer&>(**it);
00172         unit_assert(anal.opened);
00173         unit_assert(anal.updateCount == 0);
00174         unit_assert(!anal.closed);
00175     }
00176 
00177     unit_assert(cancelCallback.count == 2); 
00178 }
00179 
00180 
00181 int main(int argc, char* argv[])
00182 {
00183     try
00184     {
00185         if (argc>1 && !strcmp(argv[1],"-v")) os_ = &cout;
00186         test();
00187         return 0;
00188     }
00189     catch (exception& e)
00190     {
00191         cerr << e.what() << endl;
00192     }
00193     catch (...)
00194     {
00195         cerr << "Caught unknown exception.\n";
00196     }
00197     
00198     return 1;
00199 }
